page.title: 05EDUCATION IN OAKLEY AREA
page.content: {There are 3 schools}in the Oakley area,Inzievar,Blairhall and Holy Name which is Roman Catholic.Inzievar is the biggest with{350}children,Blair- hall has{90}and Holy Name{75.}They have their full complement of teachers and visiting teachers of art,drama, music and physical education.All 3 have their own kitchen and more than half the pupils have school lunches. Only Inzievar and Holy Name have their own playing field.Blairhall uses the local playing ground.All schools play{netball,football and badminton, {hockey and orienteering}are offered in Inzievar and Blairhall respectively. Until 1965 Inzievar was a junior secondary school,but since the start of{comprehensive education}all child- ren aged 12 transfer to Queen Anne in Dunfermline.Holy Name children go to St Columbas.
